item.description:
I recently did this loop in an effort to get back in shape and found it just enough of a workout. Please note, this is a HIKE not a walk. You should be in decent shape, with properly broken in foot (or boot) wear. Hiking poles are recommended for balance. This is a moderate hike with rolling foothills and level areas in between.

The trailhead begins at the Trailside Museum (RT 138 N) (see link). We'll take the red-dotted trail to intersection 1055 to Eliot Tower. From there we'll pick up Southern Skyline (1066) to reservation headquarters.

For the return trip we'll take Northern Skyline back to Eliot Tower, over Coon Hollow Path and back to the parking lot.

The hike may take a bit longer than our usual duration. I'm guessing 2.5 to 3 hours. Please bring plenty of water and a lunch.

The Trailside Museum parking lot is a popular one, so carpooling is recommended.

More info and trail map: http://www.mass.gov/d...
item.name: Blue Hills Loop (West Side) Hike
